page.title: 16Newton Farm.
page.content: Newton Farm is owned by Mr Bath. It was previously owned by Mr Albert Course and his family. The farm was built on land originally owned by 3 families. As a vacant possession Newton Farm is worth about Â£400,000. The farmhouse was built in 1826. The farm has 200 acres of arable land which produces corn for seed which is sold under contract to Banks of Sandy. The farm produces 800 tons of corn seed a year which is worth about Â£80,000. Nitrogen fertilizer is used on the fields. Mr Bath owns 5 tractors, 1 combine harvester and 1 fertilizer spreader.
